qas.question: Where was the port where most of the Black Sea fleet was located?
What did the Russians turn their warships into?
Why did the Russians strip their warships of their guns?
How many 60-gun frigates did the Russians lose in the Black Sea?
How many 84-gun two-deckers did the Russians lose in the Black Sea?

context: In June, the fleets transported the Allied expeditionary forces to Varna, in support of the Ottoman operations on the Danube; in September they again transported the armies, this time to the Crimea. The Russian fleet during this time declined to engage the allies, preferring to maintain a "fleet in being"; this strategy failed when <a0_0>Sevastopol<a0_0/>, the main port and where most of the Black Sea fleet was based, came under siege. The Russians were reduced to scuttling their warships as <a1_0>blockships<a1_0/>, after stripping them of their guns and men <a2_0>to reinforce batteries on shore<a2_0/>. During the siege, the Russians lost four 110- or 120-gun, three-decker ships of the line, <a4_0>twelve<a4_0/> 84-gun two-deckers and <a3_0>four<a3_0/> 60-gun frigates in the Black Sea, plus a large number of smaller vessels. During the rest of the campaign the allied fleets remained in control of the Black Sea, ensuring the various fronts were kept supplied.
